name: CalendarBot Lite
description: A lightweight Alexa skill backend with ICS calendar processing for Raspberry Pi kiosk deployment
purpose: Provide voice-based calendar queries via Alexa and 24/7 visual calendar display on a kiosk screen
primary_use_case: Raspberry Pi Zero 2W kiosk with 24/7 calendar display. The primary production deployment is a kiosk system showing calendar events on a dedicated screen, with Alexa voice integration as a secondary interface.

scale.deployment: Single instance on Raspberry Pi Zero 2W

resource_constraints.memory: <100MB RAM idle, <150MB under load (Pi Zero 2W has 512MB total)
resource_constraints.disk: SD card storage - minimize writes for longevity

codebase.active_description: Primary codebase under active development. All new features and changes go here.
codebase.archived_description: Legacy codebase - DO NOT MODIFY. Kept for historical reference only. All development has migrated to calendarbot_lite/.

key_technologies.deployment: systemd services on Raspberry Pi OS
key_technologies.testing: pytest with async support, pytest-cov, pytest-mock

architecture_principles.simplicity: Keep it simple - avoid enterprise patterns for a personal project
architecture_principles.resource_optimization: Optimize for low memory and CPU usage on Pi Zero 2W
architecture_principles.single_instance: Designed for single-instance deployment, no horizontal scaling
architecture_principles.breaking_changes_ok: Breaking changes are acceptable - controlled deployment, no API versioning needed

deployment_context.kiosk_system: Primary use case - systemd services manage both the web server and kiosk display
deployment_context.watchdog_monitoring: Progressive recovery system (soft reload → browser restart → X session restart)
deployment_context.auto_login: Automatic login and X session start for kiosk user
deployment_context.browser: Chromium in kiosk mode displaying calendar at http://localhost:8080

documentation_structure.agent_projects: agent-projects/ - Active project plans and work-in-progress documentation
documentation_structure.agent_tmp: agent-tmp/ - Temporary files, auto-pruned after 7 days (gitignored)
